sentences.en: As early as in the Paleolithic Age 30,000 years ago, human beings began to live here.
sentences.cn: 早在三万年前的旧石器时代, 人类就在此繁衍生息.

sentences.en: Early two years ago at the late Paleolithic, here left a footprint of human life.
sentences.cn: 早在两万年前的旧石器晚期, 这里就留下了人类生活的足迹.

sentences.en: Has Paleolithic Yongdusan sites of ancient human.
sentences.cn: 龙头山有旧石器时代的古人类遗址.

sentences.en: Paleolithic man could only make the most basic stone tools.
sentences.cn: 旧石器时代的人类只能制造最简单的石器.

sentences.en: Paleolithic people can walk the Earth?
sentences.cn: 旧石器时代的人能否在地球上行走?

sentences.en: Remains are assigned to the Paleolithic Age, Eastern Zhou, Eastern Han, Song dynasty and Qing dynasty.
sentences.cn: 此次发掘获得的材料包括旧石器时代 、 东周时期 、 东汉时期 、 宋代及明清时期5个时期的遗存.

sentences.en: The research discovered that paleolithic period dog's mouth department is short, and width.
sentences.cn: 研究发现,旧石器时代狗的嘴部短且宽.

sentences.en: The soil is a mix of slate and quartz that dates back to the Paleolithic era.
sentences.cn: 是一种由页岩和石英混合而成,源于旧石器时代.

sentences.en: The stone balls were tools of hunting in Paleolithic times.
sentences.cn: 石球是旧石器时代原始人用来狩猎的工具.

sentences.en: The Upper Paleolithic , in contrast , ushered in a suite of sophisticated practices.
sentences.cn: 旧石器时代晚期就不一样了, 成套的复杂行为出现了.

trans.tran_en: relating to the  stone age (= the period of time thousands of years ago when people used stone tools and weapons )
